Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Eternally \E*ter"nal*ly\, adv. In an eternal manner. [1913 Webster]
That which is morally good or evil at any time or in any case, must be also eternally and unchangeably so. --South. [1913 Webster]
Where western gales eternally reside. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
eternally adv : for a limitless time; "no one can live forever"; "brightly beams our Father's mercy from his lighthouse evermore"- P.P.Bliss [syn: {everlastingly}, {forever}, {evermore}]
